intro: Knautia persicina, commonly known as Persian knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple composite flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Knautia persicina is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
